bioghist.p: Howard L. Rice (b. 1931) was a professor at San Francisco Theological Seminary. In 1979 he was elected Moderator of the 191st General Assembly of the United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Howard L. Rice from his term as Moderator of the General Assembly, 1979-1980. Materials include: incoming and outgoing correspondence; travel and meeting agendas; Rice's sermons; General Assembly position papers; expense accounts; a small number of personnel records, such as correspondence and timecards; newspaper clippings; press releases; and newsletters. Topics of correspondence include: visits and meetings; seminaries; SALT II; prayer retreats; as well as issues of the disabled in the Church, abortion, refugees, boycotts, and the death penalty. The collection also includes several published books and pamphlets on the history of various Presbyterian churches and a guest book from a reception for Rice in Peoria, Illinois.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
